headline.main: Lighter Menus Appeal to Diners and Owners

docs.abstract: Restaurant chains nationwide are adding more nutritious choices and shrinking portion sizes;  pressures like consumer demand and looming federal regulations that will require them to post calorie counts on menus are driving changes; smaller portions are not necessarily cheaper.
docs.lead_paragraph: Pressured by looming regulations, restaurants across the United States are shrinking portion sizes, a move that is paying off financially.
docs.snippet: Pressured by looming regulations, restaurants across the United States are shrinking portion sizes, a move that is paying off financially.

headline.seo: Sotomayor Plans for Pepsi Event Stirs an Outcry
headline.print_headline: Justice’s Plans for Event Tied to Pepsi Stir Outcry by Yale Alumni
headline.main: Justice’s Plans for Event Tied to Pepsi Stir Outcry by Yale Alumni

docs.abstract: PepsiCo is sponsoring conference in April 2013 for women who attended Yale University, and Supreme Court Justice Sonia Sotomayor, Yale Law School graduate, is scheduled to make remarks, to the dismay of some alumni; long-running dispute exists between Yale and some alumni over university's connections to company, who see it as health threat.
docs.lead_paragraph: Justice Sonia Sotomayor, a graduate of Yale Law School, is scheduled to make remarks at a conference sponsored by PepsiCo, a company some alumni see as a health threat.
docs.snippet: Justice Sonia Sotomayor, a graduate of Yale Law School, is scheduled to make remarks at a conference sponsored by PepsiCo, a company some alumni see as a health threat.

headline.seo: Paul Mason Is One-Third the Man He Used to Be
headline.print_headline: Two-Thirds the Man He Used to Be, and Proud of It
headline.main: One-Third the Man He Used to Be, and Proud of It

docs.abstract: Ipswich Journal; Ipswich, England, resident Paul Mason, once dubbed world's fattest man at 980 pounds, has lost nearly two-thirds of his body weight after 2010 gastric bypass operation; series of family and personal tragedies drove Mason to chronic overeating, but therapy and surgery helped turn his life around.
docs.lead_paragraph: Since Paul Mason had gastric bypass surgery in 2010 after weighing about 980 pounds, he has lost nearly two-thirds of his body weight, but the road to a new life is uphill.
docs.snippet: Since Paul Mason had gastric bypass surgery in 2010 after weighing about 980 pounds, he has lost nearly two-thirds of his body weight, but the road to a new life is uphill.

headline.seo: U.S. Voting Flaws Are Widespread, Study Shows
headline.print_headline: Lost Votes, Problem Ballots, Long Waits? Flaws Are Widespread, Study Finds
headline.main: Lost Votes, Problem Ballots, Long Waits? Flaws Are Widespread, Study Finds

docs.abstract: Major study issued by the Pew Charitable Trusts finds deep and widespread flaws in the American election system; study ranks all 50 states based on more than 15 criteria, providing a detailed portrait of dysfunction and disenfranchisement.
docs.lead_paragraph: Problems in the election system extend beyond isolated voting issues in a few locations, according to a study from the Pew Charitable Trusts.
docs.snippet: Problems in the election system extend beyond isolated voting issues in a few locations, according to a study from the Pew Charitable Trusts.

docs.abstract: The Week column; report from Smithsonian and federal Fish and Wildlife Service on environmental damage caused by domestic cats raises serious policy questions; other significant developments in health and science news highlighted.
docs.lead_paragraph: Science Times readers on the redesigned section, last week’s science news in recap and a biopic on Stephen Hawking.
docs.snippet: Science Times readers on the redesigned section, last week’s science news in recap and a biopic on Stephen Hawking.

headline.print_headline: The Claim: When a dieter eats can influence weight loss.
headline.main: Really? Timing of Meals Affects Weight Loss

docs.abstract: Studies suggest that eating at later hours, especially main meals, can affect efforts to lose weight.
docs.snippet: Studies suggest that eating at later hours, especially main meals, can affect efforts to lose weight.

headline.seo: U.S. Releases Nutritional Rules for Snacks at Schools
headline.print_headline: U.S. Releases New Rules For School Snack Foods
headline.main: U.S. Releases New Rules for School Snack Foods

docs.abstract: Obama administration releases its long-awaited nutritional guidelines for snack foods sold in schools, in effort to combat obesity in school-age children; guidelines, which set minimum requirements for calories and fats allowed, encourage schools to offer low-fat and whole-grain snacks or fruits and to limit sugary drinks.
docs.lead_paragraph: The guidelines encourage schools to offer low-fat and whole-grain snacks or fruits and to limit sugary drinks.
docs.snippet: The guidelines encourage schools to offer low-fat and whole-grain snacks or fruits and to limit sugary drinks.
